{{cpp/ranges/join_view/title|begin}}
{{cpp/ranges/join_view/navbar}}

{{dcl begin}}
{{dcl|num=1|since=c++20|
constexpr auto begin();
}}
{{dcl|num=2|since=c++20|
constexpr auto begin() const
    requires ranges::input_range&lt;const V&gt; &amp;&amp;
             std::is_reference_v&lt;ranges::range_reference_t&lt;const V&gt;&gt;;
}}
{{dcl end}}

Returns an {{rlp|iterator}} to the first element of the {{tt|join_view}}. Given {{tti|base_}} is the underlying view,

@1@ Equivalent to
* {{c|return /*iterator*/&lt;true&gt;{*this, ranges::begin(base_)};}} if {{c|/*simple-view*/&lt;V&gt;}} is satisfied and {{c/core|ranges::range_reference_t&lt;V&gt;}} is reference type. Otherwise,
* {{c|return /*iterator*/&lt;false&gt;{*this, ranges::begin(base_)};}}.

@2@ Equivalent to {{c|return /*iterator*/&lt;true&gt;{*this, ranges::begin(base_)};}}.

===Parameters===
(none)

===Return value===
Iterator to the first element.

===Notes===
When {{c/core|ranges::range_reference_t&lt;V&gt;}} is not a reference type, that is, deferencing an iterator of {{tt|V}} returns a prvalue temporary, the {{tt|join_view}} is only an {{lconcept|input_range}}, in which case only single-pass iteration is supported, and repeated calls to {{tt|begin()}} may not give meaningful results.
